profess an Albanian identity. With those that have only partial Albanian
ancestry and the Turkified ones the number is about 1,300,000, most of whom do
not speak Albanian. }}


'Albanians' () are defined as an ethnic group native to Albania and neighboring
countries or as citizens of the Republic of Albania regardless of ethnicity. Ethnic Albanians speak the Albanian language and more than half
of ethnic Albanians live in Albania and Kosovo. The Albanian diaspora also
exists in a number of other countries.
categories: Ethnic groups in Bosnia and Herzegovina
Ethnic groups in the Republic of Macedonia
